instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 Fan spin, no chime - vcore present
threads.message:
Hi there,

I've just had a board in thats had a lot of work done to it :-(

So symptoms are:

Fan spins for about 5 seconds when connected to power then stops. Then it starts again and stays on - fan goes high.

I have gone through all the power rails - all present including vcore at 1.8v.

Does anyone have a clue what it could be?

I obviously have zero hints due to loads of old flux etc.

Thanks
Jamie

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 Fan spin, no chime - vcore present
threads.message: Any history?? corrosion on J6100? water damage around SMC or U1900??

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 Fan spin, no chime - vcore present
threads.message: UPDATE: Might have been a bit quick to post - looks like someone replaced the SMC but it looked awful - reflow seems to have it powered on and working. A lovely bath needed I think!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 Fan spin, no chime - vcore present
threads.message: Working fine after an ultrasonic and pre heat!! :)
